text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <SENTENCE>In denen Thurneysischen Buchläsden allhier werden die ersten zwey Theile von folgendem Werck denen Herren Subseribenten ausgelaffert:</SENTENCE>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Roberti Stephani</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Thesaurus Linguae Latinae post noviss. Londin. edit. insignitor auctam Annokationibus Honrici Stephani Locupletatus</TITLE>
    <EDITOR>Nova cura retensuit digessit &c. <AUTHOR>Ant. Birrius</AUTHOR></EDITOR>
    <FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <SENTENCE>Ingleichen geben sie auch den</SENTENCE>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>T. Lieium e. Integr. Sigonii & Gronovior Norit</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>3. Voll.</VOLUME>
    <FORMAT>in 8.</FORMAT>
    <PRICE>fl. 6.</PRICE>
    <NOTE>künftige Wochen an die Herren Liebhaber aus, dieser Preis aber währet nur biß Ende Januarii <YEAR>1740</YEAR>. nach welcher Zeit kein Eremplar unter <PRICE>7fl. 30. xr.</PRICE> verkaufft werden solle.</NOTE>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":10,"explanation":"The original input contained character encoding issues (e.g., 



) which were interpreted as malformed XML/text artifacts. These were corrected to standard German characters (ä, ß, ü, &). The overall structure was assumed to be a list of bibliographic entries within an <ITEM> tag. I broke the text into logical <SENTENCE> segments and introduced an <EDITOR> tag for the secondary author/editor, corrected '<PRIZE>' to '<PRICE>' for consistency, and fixed the '&' entities. I also restructured the second bibliographic entry slightly for clarity based on common German book notices, putting the price/date information into a <NOTE> tag as it wasn't purely descriptive bibliographic data like title or format."}

parsed.fixed_xml:
<ITEM>
  <SENTENCE>In denen Thurneysischen Buchläsden allhier werden die ersten zwey Theile von folgendem Werck denen Herren Subseribenten ausgelaffert:</SENTENCE>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Roberti Stephani</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Thesaurus Linguae Latinae post noviss. Londin. edit. insignitor auctam Annokationibus Honrici Stephani Locupletatus</TITLE>
    <EDITOR>Nova cura retensuit digessit &c. <AUTHOR>Ant. Birrius</AUTHOR></EDITOR>
    <FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <SENTENCE>Ingleichen geben sie auch den</SENTENCE>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>T. Lieium e. Integr. Sigonii & Gronovior Norit</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>3. Voll.</VOLUME>
    <FORMAT>in 8.</FORMAT>
    <PRICE>fl. 6.</PRICE>
    <NOTE>künftige Wochen an die Herren Liebhaber aus, dieser Preis aber währet nur biß Ende Januarii <YEAR>1740</YEAR>. nach welcher Zeit kein Eremplar unter <PRICE>7fl. 30. xr.</PRICE> verkaufft werden solle.</NOTE>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
The original input contained character encoding issues (e.g., 



) which were interpreted as malformed XML/text artifacts. These were corrected to standard German characters (ä, ß, ü, &). The overall structure was assumed to be a list of bibliographic entries within an <ITEM> tag. I broke the text into logical <SENTENCE> segments and introduced an <EDITOR> tag for the secondary author/editor, corrected '<PRIZE>' to '<PRICE>' for consistency, and fixed the '&' entities. I also restructured the second bibliographic entry slightly for clarity based on common German book notices, putting the price/date information into a <NOTE> tag as it wasn't purely descriptive bibliographic data like title or format.
